IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of United Church Homes and Services is to carry on Christian ministry in the Southern Conference of the United Church of Christ that adds life to the years of those we serve by providing senior living and health related communities, benevolence assistance and service programs of outreach into the wider community.
IRS990.Description: United Church Homes and Services owns and operates continuing care retirement communities in Newton ("Abernethy Laurels") and Thomasville ("Piedmont Crossing"), North Carolina, consisting of residential living units, assisted living units and nursing facilities providing adult care and intermediate and skilled nursing care, and a skilled nursing facility in Lexington, North Carolina ("Centerclair").

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Benevolent assistance for residents who are unable to pay for continuing care at the residential facilities operated by United Church Homes and Services. Five primary residents received benevolent funds, and many residents received block grants. Block grants are assistance provided to multiple residents in need.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The benevolent assistance funds are managed by the organization's finance personnel to cover the expenses of indigent residents. The assistance is disbursed on an as needed case by case basis.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 is reviewed by the board's Finance Committee before filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Officers, directors and employees of the organization have an obligation to conduct business within guidelines that prohibit actual or potential conflicts of interest. All employees and board members are required to evaluate compliance with conflict of interest policy annually and disclose any potential conflicts.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation of the organization's top management is determined by the board's executive committee. The process for determining compensation includes salary surveys of similar organizations across the country as well as the use of comparability data. Compensation of officers and key employees is suggested by the CEO and approved by the executive committee.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are kept on file at the administration office and are available for public inspection upon request.
